JUVE Patent updated this article on 02.03.2023 to reflect the latest decision in the ongoing case between Biogen and generic drug companies concerning Tecfidera.
Name_5: The Top 25 Sales Executives in Healthcare Technology of 2022
Text_5:
The Healthcare Technology Report is pleased to announce The Top 25 Sales Executives in Healthcare Technology of 2022. Sales executives are the key to successful interactions between an organization and its clients leading a team of sales professionals who perform the vital tasks of introducing products structuring deals and offering advice. The awardees on this year’s list are responsible for overseeing all sales-related activities including assessing implementing and reporting on sales strategies that will bring in more revenue and grow their companies. And in the healthcare technology field this growth directly equates to more patients benefited and more lives saved.

Some of the elite sales executives on this year’s list include Kortney Cooper VP Sales for AmerisourceBergen which is making a positive impact on the health of people and communities around the world by advancing the development and delivery of wholesale pharmaceuticals and healthcare products. VP and Sales Executive Leslie Selby of Epic is focused on developing sales strategies globally and leading large enterprise sales for health organizations in the U.S. Canada and the U.K. And Simon Cotton VP of Sales Hematology & Oncology for Jazz Pharmaceuticals which has continued to push the boundaries of oncology with the development of major new treatments in its product pipeline including new applications of its Rylaze drug for the treatment of leukemia.

The development of new healthcare technologies is both incredibly difficult and supremely rewarding. But those rewards can only be maximized through the efforts of great sales executives who are able to get those technologies into the right hands. For companies across a range of healthcare specialties the awardees on this year’s list have been able to do just that. Please join us in celebrating The Top 25 Sales Executives in Healthcare Technology of 2022.

1. George Zarkalis

Company: Viatris

Title: Global Head of Sales Excellence & Omnichannel Deployment

George Zarkalis is the Global Head of Sales Excellence & Omnichannel Deployment of Viatris a global pharmaceutical and healthcare company. Formed in 2020 Viatris focuses on a wide variety of therapeutic areas empowering people worldwide by expanding their access to a broad range of trusted quality medications regardless of geography or circumstance.

Most recently Zarkalis served as the global head of sales & KAM execution for Novartis a healthcare technology company he served for 17 years in various roles. He also introduced and managed its Voice of the Customer (VoC) initiative a customer feedback system. Previously he was a corporate sales manager at Germanos Group and a marketing and sales coordinator at SC Johnson.

He holds a master’s degree in chemical engineering from the National Technical University of Athens and an executive certificate in technology & operations from the MIT Sloan School of Management. He also received additional executive education at the Harvard Business School.

2. Melanie Fox

Company: Banner Health

Title: Chief Sales Officer

Melanie Fox is the Chief Sales Officer for Banner Health a non-profit health system based in Phoenix Arizona. Formed in 1999 Banner Health is one of the largest nonprofit healthcare systems providing emergency and hospital care hospice long-term/home care outpatient surgery labs rehabilitation services pharmacies and primary care. In 2021 it reported revenue in excess of $12 billion; Fox joined the company in her current role the same year.

Prior to Banner Health Fox was a business development consultant with Clover Health and vice president of broker development at Bravo Health (Cigna). Her career in healthcare began in 2003 as director of business development for Health Net of Arizona. She also co-founded TROY Skincare in 2017. She holds a bachelor’s degree in business/healthcare management from the American InterContinental University and studied business and marketing at Oregon State University.

3. Kortney Cooper

Company: AmerisourceBergen

Sales: Vice President Sales

With a strong work ethic and attention to detail Kortney Cooper PhD has found success as the Vice President of Sales with AmerisourceBergen an American drug wholesale company formed by the merger of Bergen Brunswig and AmeriSource in 2001. AmerisourceBergen fosters a positive impact on the health of people and communities around the world by advancing the development and delivery of pharmaceuticals and healthcare products. Cooper joined the company in 2020 as a senior director of strategic accounts before ascending to her current role in 2022.

Prior to AmerisourceBergen Cooper served as a Mid-Atlantic account executive at Cefaly Technology and an account executive at US Bioservices. In 2020 she served as a technical project manager at the University of Dayton Research Institute. She holds a bachelor’s degree in chemistry from Troy University a PhD in nuclear chemistry from Michigan State University and an Executive MBA from the Quantic School of Business and Technology.

4. Leslie Selby

Company: Epic Systems

Title: Vice President and Sales Executive

Leslie E. Selby is a Vice President and Sales Executive for Epic the healthcare industry’s #1-ranked creator of electronic health records software. Her areas of focus include developing sales strategies globally and leading large enterprise sales for health organizations in the U.S. Canada and the U.K. as well as large-scale procurements by U.S. government agencies.

Selby started in Epic’s implementation division leading large healthcare organizations through successful software deployments. Before joining Epic she served as Legislative Liaison and Sales Director for the Wisconsin Medical Association. She has also served as Home Health Care Coordinator for a private-duty home health agency. In 2021 Selby was recognized as one of the Top Women Leaders in Healthcare Software by the Healthcare Technology Report. She holds a BS in Political Science from the University of Wisconsin – La Crosse which included time in the U.K. studying at the University of West London. She is a member and supporter of Daughters of the American Revolution as well as a volunteer fundraising for a local Veterans Memorial Park.

5. Gary Stapleton

Company: Bausch + Lomb

Title: Vice President Sales

For more than 15 years Gary Stapleton has been an exemplary leader at Bausch + Lomb where he has served in multiple senior-level executive roles currently serving as Vice President of Sales. Founded in 1853 Bausch + Lomb is an American healthcare technology company with nearly 170 years of expertise making it one of the most trusted organizations of its kind. The company is one of the world's largest suppliers of contact lenses lens care products and other eye care products. It currently employs more than 21000 professionals and makes healthcare products in about 100 countries.

Stapleton joined Bausch + Lomb in 2007 and has held roles in sales marketing and operations. He has served as VP of sales & marketing generics VP of operations and VP of U.S. pharmaceutical sales leading a number of diverse teams as the company has amassed a market cap of more than $5 billion. During his tenure the company has grown its revenue to more than $3 billion in multiple years. He attended the University of Phoenix.

6. Suzanne Haggard

Company: LCMC Health

Title: Chief Revenue Officer

In her capacity as Chief Revenue Officer at New Orleans-based nonprofit health system LCMC Health Suzanne Haggard has repeatedly distinguished herself as a leader in the field of healthcare technology. Having contributed her leadership skills to the company’s continued growth over the last 18 years Haggard has been honored as a Healthcare Hero by New Orleans CityBusiness and a standout female executive by publications including Becker’s Hospital Review.

Before joining LCMC formerly Touro Infirmary Haggard was an audit manager at Deloitte for seven years and for nearly a decade she worked to provide top-tier healthcare consulting services to major hospitals and healthcare providers through the firm of Haggard & Associates. Haggard holds a bachelor’s and a master’s degree in professional accountancy from Mississippi State University with specializations in computer science as well as accounting and finance.

7. Simon Cotton

Company: Jazz Pharmaceuticals

Title: Vice President of Sales Hematology & Oncology

One of the healthcare technology world’s leading figures in hematology and oncology product launches and sales Simon Cotton has worked as the Vice President of Sales Hematology & Oncology at Irish pharmaceutical manufacturer Jazz Pharmaceuticals since 2021. Under his guidance Jazz has continued to push the boundaries of oncology with the development of major new treatments in its product pipeline including new applications of its Rylaze drug for the treatment of leukemia.

Cotton boasts a long and storied career in the healthtech field: before joining Jazz he was vice president of sales with Clovis Oncology and he served in directorship positions with Genentech for more than a decade. Cotton holds a bachelor’s degree in kinesiology and exercise science from the University of Maryland as well as a master’s degree in exercise physiology from West Chester University of Pennsylvania.

8. Mitch Bernatsky

Company: Aegis Therapies

Title: Vice President Sales

Texan healthcare technology company Aegis is fortunate to have Mitch Bernatsky as its reigning Vice President Sales: Bernatsky is a seasoned veteran of sales not only in the healthcare world but in a wide range of industries. Under Bernatsky’s leadership directing sales initiatives throughout the 42 states Aegis serves the company has led the charge in improving healthcare outcomes for thousands of Americans needing critical therapies at home or in rehabilitation hospitals.

Before joining Aegis Bernatsky worked as COO of logistics company Dedicated Carriers building on his years of experience in key positions with PassportMD and telecommunications carrier Knology. Bernatsky earned a bachelor’s degree in marketing from the University of Florida.

9. Kathy O’Malley

Company: Leica Biosystems

Title: Director of Sales – Pathology

Kathy O’Malley has worked as Director of Sales – Pathology at German medical device manufacturer Leica Biosystems since February of 2022. She has served the company in its mission to transform cancer diagnostics and treatment for over eight years previously working in various senior sales and account management positions. She is recognized as one of the industry’s leading minds in fields including sales operations life sciences and oncology.

Before joining Leica in 2014 O’Malley distinguished herself as an agile and insightful leader in sales management positions with Agilent Technologies and Thermo Fisher Scientific. O’Malley holds a bachelor’s degree in biochemistry from Oregon State University a certificate in genomics and genetics from Stanford University and further certifications in business analytics and negotiation mastery from Harvard Business School.

10. Megan Pinter

Company: Tandem Diabetes Care

Title: National Sales Director

Tandem Diabetes Care’s National Sales Director is Megan Pinter a veteran of healthcare technology with more than eight years in her current position. Under her considerable experience in medical device sales the company has been recognized as the #1 most trusted name in insulin pump manufacturers in customer satisfaction. Pinter has achieved major success for Tandem through her mastery of the Challenger Sales Model and wide-reaching experience in sales training and product launches.

Before she began her most recent post with Tandem Pinter served as regional development manager at Tempe-based medical equipment manufacturer Align Technology delivering best-in-region growth in the company’s revenue. She also worked as senior territory manager with Medtronic winning numerous awards for her work with that company. Pinter earned a bachelor’s degree in marketing from Arizona State University.

11. Krista Kelley

Company: MedImpact Healthcare Systems

Title: Senior Vice President of Sales and Marketing

Since taking up her current position as Senior Vice President of Sales and Marketing at MedImpact Healthcare Systems the nation’s largest privately-held pharmacy benefit manager Krista Kelley has helped the company continue to deliver next-level healthcare results across the industry. She has been with the company since 2018 rising from the position of vice president of strategic relations and sales support before serving two years as general sales manager.

Before she joined MedImpact Kelley was a longtime vice president of large employer sales at hospitals and healthcare solutions provider Express Scripts. Additionally she worked to build new business development with East Coast Lenders and implemented revolutionary marketing and customer service practices at Curl Up & Due a company she co-founded in Chicago in 1998. Kelley studied at Frostburg State University as well as continuing executive leadership training through Columbia Business School.

12. Katie Higgins

Company: Crossover Health

Title: Chief Revenue Officer

Katie Higgins is passionate about creating a healthcare model that achieves easier access greater affordability and reliable outcomes for all individuals. Throughout her career she has built and led teams that provide outstanding client service and innovative partnership opportunities for healthcare companies. Keys to her success have been identifying and cultivating great talent and creating strong team camaraderie which combine to help achieve ambitious business objectives with clients primarily in the provider market. Higgins is also known for her commitment to cultivating rising female talent—a critical need in the healthcare industry.

Before joining Crossover Higgins spent three years at Optum leading teams that created innovative collaborations with health systems which ensured the continued delivery of care and service in the local community. Prior to Optum she spent 20 years with The Advisory Board Company building account management and sales operations for new business endeavors. Her most recent role was General Manager of Strategic Accounts where she facilitated and oversaw relationships with the nation’s largest health systems. In her role at Crossover Higgins will oversee account management employer sales and payer sales and will lead marketing and corporate communications. Higgins earned a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from Davidson College in North Carolina.

13. Tom Maraday

Company: Omada Health

Title: Senior Vice President Head of Sales

Tom Maraday Senior Vice President and Head of Sales at Omada Health leads a 40-person team of the finest sales executives in virtual healthcare. Omada Health is one of the largest and fastest growing clinical providers of virtual healthcare. Recently Omada completed a series E fund raising round of $192 million which included a $1 billion plus valuation.

Prior to Omada Maraday was the Chief Development Officer at EHE Health. Before EHE he served as Vice President of Client Relations at Bright Horizons Family Solutions. He started his career at Plus One Health Management rising through nine positions to become the Chief Development Officer. He led the company to be the fastest-growing in the corporate fitness and wellness industry including five consecutive years on the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies list.

Maraday earned a Bachelor of Science in Human Performance and Nutrition from Southern Connecticut State University and has received certifications from Columbia University IESE Business School-Barcelona and the Human Performance Institute. He currently sits on the board of directors for the DJ Dream Fund a non-profit providing financial support to help underserved children participate in youth sports and the arts. He is also a member of the Knights of Columbus.

14. Larry Tischer

Company: Medartis

Title: Vice President of Sales

As Vice President of Sales for Swiss medical equipment manufacturer Medartis Larry Tischer has been in charge of strategic execution for multiple sales channels for the company across the U.S. Most notably in his two years with the company he has led the launch of new Medartis fracture and reconstruction implants.

Tischer can claim decades of successful leadership with multiple major healthcare technology providers having worked in sales director positions with Ortho Solutions Group Codman & Shurtleff and Healthpoint. A passionate volunteer he served on the board of the Orland Park Pioneers for three years and has frequently contributed his time and effort to the Make-A-Wish Foundation children’s charity. Tischer earned a bachelor’s degree in business and corporate communications from Eastern Illinois University.

15. Maurizio Cevenini

Company: Wellspect HealthCare

Title: Vice President Sales

Maurizio Cevenini is Vice President Sales at Wellspect HealthCare. He first joined the healthcare solutions provider in 2012 working initially as managing director before rising to oversee sales throughout the South Europe region. Cevenini is regarded as a visionary people-first manager driving the company’s continued expansion in a growing market.

Among his numerous career highlights prior to joining Wellspect Cevenini distinguished himself over eleven years as business unit director for Astra Tech leading that company’s healthcare urology division in Italy. He also delivered major performance transformation at Antoine Brew Service and worked as business manager of Becton Dickinson for more than ten years. Cevenini holds a degree in physics and economics from the University of Bologna.

16. Ben Beadle-Ryby

Company: AKASA

Title: Co-Founder

Ben Beadle-Ryby co-founded healthcare IT services provider AKASA in 2018. Building off his previous years of experience with Optum and The Advisory Board Company he has helped AKASA grow into the world’s leading developer of AI-driven healthcare operations solutions. In addition to skillfully entering his company into a difficult high-demand marketplace Beadle-Ryby’s leadership has earned numerous awards for AKASA as one of the best workplaces in the healthcare industry.

An enthusiastic volunteer as well as a celebrated entrepreneur he has captained numerous teams through the Movember Foundation to raise hundreds of thousands of dollars to combat prostate cancer and other men’s health crises. Beadle-Ryby holds a bachelor’s degree in mathematical economics from Colorado College and pursued studies in Mandarin and Chinese culture at Capital Normal University.

17. John Baird

Company: Visby Medical

Title: Vice President of Sales

As Denver-based medical equipment company Visby Medical’s Vice President of Sales John Baird is responsible for bringing the latest developments in fast accurate testing to healthcare providers across the nation. Visby’s work in delivering the world’s only instrument-free rapid PCR test has been particularly critical over the COVID-19 pandemic and the company has also developed critical on-site sexual health PCR tests.

A major figure in the world of biopharmaceuticals Baird has distinguished himself with years of leadership at medical equipment manufacturer Masimo and BioPorto Diagnostics. He first established his reputation as a visionary leader in the healthcare field as senior vice president for sales and business development with Critical Diagnostics. Baird holds a master’s degree in pharmacology from New York Medical College.

18. Kieran O’Kane

Company: Biodesix

Title: Chief Commercial Officer

Kieran O’Kane has served as Chief Commercial Officer of Biodesix since March 2020 and has been with the company in marketing management and corporate development roles since February 2018. He is an experienced commercial leader with a career focus in oncology. His depth of experience stemming from an academic background in Pharmacology more than 23 years in the industry including more than 10 product launches globally across pharma medical device and clinical diagnostics and a strong personal motivation to positively impact health outcomes is the basis of his overall success in driving commercial growth at Biodesix.

Prior to joining Biodesix O’Kane led the Global Diagnostics Marketing team at Nanostring Technologies a biotechnology company focused on developing cancer diagnostic tools. He held various commercial leadership positions in sales and marketing functions in addition to managing pricing reimbursement health technology appraisal and national payor strategy at companies including Biotheranostics CTI Biopharma Eisai Cephalon Bristol-Myers Squibb and Roche.

19. Katrina Escandon

Company: Osso VR

Title: Director of Sales Operations & Development

Katrina Escandon is the Director of Sales Operations & Development for Osso VR a leading virtual reality surgical training and assessment company. She is responsible for supporting the commercial organization by managing the company’s sales applications and CRM forecasting and reporting collaborating on and creating commission plans and developing new and expansion pipelines. This includes leading the Sales Operations Analytics and Development teams.

Prior to her current position Escandon was the VP of Commercial Operations at WebMD Provider Services (also known as Krames formerly known as The StayWell Company). During her time at WebMD Provider Services she had responsibility for reporting sales forecasting revenue and expenses pricing and project management for custom print solutions leading a team of admins and developers to maintain and enhance the CRM tool developing commission plans with sales management and processing commission payouts. In addition Escandon led the inbound and outbound telesales teams along with the sales operations team which included the deal desk sales support processes proposal writing and contract billing functions. She worked at StayWell for more than 15 years in Sales Operations and Analytics roles.

Escandon gained valuable experience as part of the original team to launch Salesforce as the CRM tool for StayWell. In addition as part of multiple acquisitions and mergers at WebMD Provider Services she has been part of integrating and consolidating teams reports processes and commission models. Escandon graduated from Princeton University with a Bachelor of Arts in classics and finance.

20. Lynn Wagner

Company: Pegasus Senior Living

Title: Divisional Vice President of Sales

In her position as Divisional Vice President of Sales for Pegasus Senior Living Lynn Wagner has consistently pushed the boundaries of achievement for sales and growth. In the three years in which she has held her current post Wagner has transformed multiple elder care communities run by Pegasus increasing occupancy above 90% in multiple cases and frequently having her efforts recognized as a top-producing member of the company’s administrative staff.

On top of her considerable history as a change-maker in senior living community marketing and management Wagner is a longtime veteran of the healthcare field working for more than fifteen years in healthcare staffing and senior living enhancement. Wagner pursued her studies in nursing from Collin College.

21. Harish Panchal

Company: Health Gorilla

Title: Chief Revenue Officer

Health Gorilla Chief Revenue Officer Harish Panchal has more than 20 years of experience in healthcare technology and a proven track record of building high-performing sales organizations. At Health Gorilla Panchal has used his data-driven approach to drive predictable repeatable revenue and enhance efficiencies for a more seamless sales cycle. His focus is on executing against the go-to-market strategy scaling operations and activating the team at scale.

Panchal joined Health Gorilla from TigerConnect where revenue tripled in his four years of leadership and a strategic growth investment from Vista Equity Partners was accepted. Previously he was responsible for overall revenue for the Rhapsody Integration Engine at Orion Health. Under his guidance the business unit grew to more than 700 enterprise customers in 36 countries with a successful transaction with Hg Capital. Panchal has a Bachelor of Engineering Science from Auckland University in New Zealand and an advanced certification in Disruptive Strategy from Harvard Business School.

22. Rachel Rearden

Company: Ever/Body

Title: Vice President Sales

Rachel Rearden is the Vice President Sales for Ever/Body. Ever/Body is a haven for high-performance beauty services founded around the mission to demystify cosmetic dermatology and make it more accessible. It offers a curated collection of clinically-tested face and body treatments delivered by trusted medical professionals and designed to deliver natural-looking (not obvious) results. All in under 60 minutes.

Rearden is a visionary seasoned and innovative sales and operations executive with more than 30 years of progressive experience throughout the sales pipeline including leadership and training channel development competitive analysis and strategic implementation. She is recognized in the industry for turning around traditionally underperforming markets and teams through active problem identification and swift corrective action. Prior to Ever/Body she was National Director of Sales Operations Field Support & Clinic Openings for Ideal Image. Rearden holds a bachelor’s degree in finance and financial management services from Maryville University of Saint Louis.

23. Nicole Neutz

Company: VirtualHealth

Title: Vice President Sales

Nicole Neutz is Vice President Sales for VirtualHealth. The company’s HELIOS® platform is the first comprehensive care management platform purpose-built to power the entire ecosystem of care. Utilized by some of the most innovative health plans in the country to manage millions of members HELIOS® streamlines value-based and person-centered care with intelligent case disease and utilization management workflows standard and custom data integrations broad-spectrum collaboration patient engagement real-time telehealth and configurable analytics and reporting.

Prior to VirtualHealth Neutz was VP of the Insurer & Group Business for GetInsured. She also served as a senior business consultant for Array Health and as an account manager for Aetna U.S. Healthcare. She holds a bachelor’s degree in cultural anthropology from Washington State University.

24. Amber Kerby

Company: Pain Specialists of America

Title: Vice President Sales and Marketing

Amber Kerby is the Vice President of Sales and Marketing for Pain Specialists of America (PSA). PSA is a leading Interventional Pain Management company that identifies pain generators and interrupts the pain cycle with the latest technology available. Their purpose is to offer the most advanced interventional options while providing personalized treatment plans to get patients back to living a functional and quality life. At PSA the patient is at the center of every decision made. The entire team is committed to staying at the forefront from an exceptional patient journey to innovation and technology.

Amber joined PSA in 2018 as a seasoned leader fueled by 15 years of broad experience assuring strategy and efficiency. Before joining PSA in 2018 Amber was senior vice president of the top pain management group in the U.S. helping to grow the company from 7 to 64 offices in 12 states and implemented one of the first experience departments in a private practice setting led by a Chief Experience Officer. She has worked with leading startup companies from healthcare technology to practice M&A. The foundation for her success is to motivate and inspire high-performing accountable teams.

25. Matt McColgan

Company: Radiation Detection Company

Title: Vice President Sales

Matt McColgan is Vice President of Sales for the Radiation Detection Company. He is an experienced senior sales leader with a passion for driving team members to achieve new levels of success. He believes in approaching every opportunity with an unrelenting commitment to integrity customer service and continuous improvement. The ability to learn teach and direct organizational strategic movements for both the team and the organization is what drives Matt to be successful every day.

Prior to Radiation Detection Company McColgan served as Director of Enterprise Sales for Frontier Communications and before that he was Director of Sales and Vendor Management for Vology. He earned a bachelor’s degree in philosophy from the University of California Santa Barbara.

Name: Vici Properties
Name_1: B&B Spoilers Recap For October 10: Thomas Ruffled Some Feathers
Text_1:
B&B spoilers recap for Monday October 10 2022 features Thomas Forrester bragging about his mother’s win to people who did not really want to hear it.

B&B Spoilers Recap Highlights

Over in Aspen Steffy Forrester Finnegan (Jacqueline MacInnes Wood) was one happy kid when she realized her plan worked. All her nagging paid off and her mommy and daddy are a couple again. Oh joy! The trio wasted no time videoing Thomas (Matthew Atkinson) to spread the good news.

READ THIS: Find out what’s happening next on Bold and the Beautiful.

Taylor Hayes (Krista Allen) was beside herself with happiness. She never thought this would happen. Ridge Forrester (Thorsten Kaye) made a promise to Taylor and Steffy that he would protect her heart from now on…forever and ever and ever. Oh boy Taylor is one lucky lady! She was so giddy she decide to take a moment upstairs with Steffy to collect herself.

B&B Recap: Brooke Lost The Game

Meanwhile Brooke Logan Forrester (Katherine Kelly Lang) was reminiscing about her “destiny” during her mad dash to the property. Sadly by the time she made it to the house it was over. Ridge was with Taylor and her marriage was caput.

She caught up with Ridge when he decided to get some fresh air. He hardly got a few steps from the house before Brooke pulled up in a chauffeured jeep and ran after him. She demanded to know what he was doing at the property. Ridge shocked her by telling her he was with Taylor now.

The Bold and the Beautiful Recap: Thomas Was All Smiles

Back in Los Angles Douglas Forrester (Henry Joseph Samiri) played a joke on his dad using his voice app. He pretended to be his great-grandpa saying he didn’t need to do his homework. Thomas scolded the little boy for playing such games and told him to stop using that app altogether. No good comes from practical jokes.

After sending Douglas off Thomas got busy telling Eric Forrester (John McCook) and Donna Logan (Jennifer Gareis) about his parent’s reunion. The couple was shocked and dismayed Brooke didn’t make it to Aspen in time. How sad.

Thomas was not sad of course and boasted about Brooke’s downfall. His father deserves a loyal woman and that certainly isn’t Brooke and never has been. Taylor is the best woman (blah blah blah). Donna and Eric certainly were not happy to hear all the Brooke bashing.

The Bold and the Beautiful airs weekdays on CBS. For an in-depth look at the show’s history click here.

The best place for true soap fans to be is our Facebook groups. Have you joined? If you love soap spoilers gossip and fans as dedicated as yourself check out Days of our Lives Fans General Hospital Exclusive The Young and the Restless Fans and The Bold and the Beautiful Fans.

Name_3: B&B Spoilers Recap For October 11: Thomas Showed His True Colors
Text_3:
B&B spoilers recap for Tuesday October 11 2022 features Brooke Logan Forrester fighting for her marriage while Thomas Forrester secretly revealed he is the one who single-handedly ruined it.

B&B Spoilers Recap Highlights

Brooke (Katherine Kelly Lang) tried to appeal to her husband’s sense of reasoning but no reasoning was to be had. Not only did Ridge Forrester (Thorsten Kaye) flat-out dump her and insist he was going back to Taylor Hayes (Krista Allen) but he refused to give her a reason why.

READ THIS: Find out what’s happening next on Bold and the Beautiful.

All Ridge would say is Brooke “knew why” she was being downgraded to ex-wife and it was time to admit it. Brooke was understandably confused and cried for Ridge to come home and sort things out. All he did was grimace and shake his head.

B&B Recap: More Family Feuds

Inside the Aspen cabin Taylor and Steffy Forrester Finnegan (Jacqueline MacInnes Wood) were as giddy as school girls over Taylor’s big win. That is until they noticed Brooke outside. Taylor insisted she wasn’t worried but Steffy was so panicked she even called Thomas Forrester (Matthew Atkinson).

Thomas got the call as he was basically laughing in Donna Logan’s (Jennifer Gareis) face. Her sister lost his mother won blah blah blah. Donna and Eric Forrester (John McCook) warned him to not count Brooke out yet.

The trio went back and forth over what Brooke Ridge and Taylor’s future holds. Donna was Team Brooke naturally. Thomas was absolutely on his mother’s side. As for Eric he spoke highly of both women but admitted he had a soft spot for Brooke. They do share a past that includes children after all.

When Thomas answered the phone to Steffy a bit of a tiff broke out between her and Donna when the latter revealed she was the one who directed Brooke to Aspen. Steffy demanded Donna keep her nose out of the family’s business (hi pot meet kettle). Donna was so heated she asked Eric to take her for a drive.

The Bold and the Beautiful Recap: The Truth Came Out!

Once alone in the mansion Thomas was very proud of himself. He smirked about finally besting Brooke. A call to CPS isn’t something Ridge will ever be able to forgive. Of course it wasn’t Brooke who called at all. It was Thomas using the voice-changing app his son likes to play with. What a tricky trickster!

The Bold and the Beautiful airs weekdays on CBS. For an in-depth look at the show’s history click here.

Name: Visa Inc
Name_1: Visa Inc. Appoints Kermit R. Crawford to its Board of Directors
Text_1:
SAN FRANCISCO--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Visa Inc. (NYSE: V) announced today that Kermit R. Crawford was appointed to its board of directors effective October 7 2022.

Mr. Crawford was president and chief operating officer of Rite Aid Corporation from October 2017 until March 2019. Prior to joining Rite Aid he served as an operating partner and advisor with private equity firm Sycamore Partners from July 2015 to February 2017. He also served in various senior leadership roles including as executive vice president and president of Pharmacy Health and Wellness at Walgreens Boots Alliance from 1983 to 2014. Mr. Crawford also serves on the boards of directors of C.H. Robinson Worldwide and The Allstate Corporation.

“I am pleased to welcome Kermit to Visa’s board of directors” said Al Kelly Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Visa Inc. “Kermit is a seasoned executive with over 30 years of leadership and operating experience with consumer and retail companies that will be invaluable to Visa. He will provide the board with a deep understanding of consumer experiences and insights as well as extensive experience in business strategy risk and financial management and corporate governance."

This appointment brings Visa’s total board of directors to 12 members. You can view information on Visa Inc.’s board of directors on our investor relations website: investor.visa.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors/

About Visa Inc.

Visa Inc. (NYSE: V) is a world leader in digital payments facilitating transactions between consumers merchants financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative convenient reliable and secure payment network enabling individuals businesses and economies to thrive. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere uplift everyone everywhere and see access as foundational for the future of money movement. Learn more at Visa.com.
Name_2: Wildfire Systems to Power New Loyalty and Rewards Program for Visa's Global Network of Card Issuers
Text_2:
Wildfire's platform will enable Visa card issuers to deploy online shopping rewards programs as a benefit to their cardholders

SAN DIEGO Oct. 11 2022 /PRNewswire/ -- Wildfire Systems today announced it has partnered with Visa the world leader in digital payments to launch the new Visa Affiliate Marketing Solutions (VAMS) program. Wildfire's innovative financial technology platform will power Visa's VAMS program providing the company's vast network of card issuers with a rich set of benefits they will deliver to consumers with the most advanced and comprehensive shopping rewards solution on the market today.

Visa's VAMS offering will enable issuers to provide cashback rewards coupons and other benefits to cardholders when they shop at thousands of online retailers. The program is available to Visa's issuer clients throughout the globe supported by Wildfire's extensive coverage of over 50000 merchant programs in 55 countries. By extending cashback and discounts to cardholders Visa and its issuers are now able to help consumers save and earn money when they shop which is especially important and timely given the recent spike in inflation. In addition to driving customer loyalty and retention issuers of both credit and debit cards will benefit from new revenue sources driven by merchant-funded rewards.

The program is a win-win-win for card issuers which can build a new revenue stream and increase customer retention as well as cardholders who will save and earn money. Retailers will also benefit from increased sales conversion rates and higher average order values.

"Despite high inflation ecommerce continues to grow as consumers shop online to find the best offers and deals to offset higher prices. Visa recognizes that more than ever rewards programs provide a competitive advantage to their issuers and are expected by savvy consumers with years of comparison shopping experience" said Jordan Glazier CEO Wildfire Systems. "We are very excited to partner with Visa to bring a white-label turnkey rewards solution to the market for their card issuers helping Visa extend their VAMS program to their partners worldwide providing a revenue boost to merchants and cost savings to consumers as a result."

Wildfire's technology provides consumers with more ways to save money and earn cashback on any mobile device or desktop computer giving Visa card issuers a highly effective customer acquisition strategy that has been proven to boost retention and brand loyalty.

"It has always been a priority for us to provide our issuer partners with the tools they need to be successful" said Tad Tilahun Head of Payment Platforms Visa. "This collaboration with Wildfire will give our partners a simple and robust reward solution that seamlessly expands their consumer engagement opportunities."

Wildfire's enterprise platform allows financial institutions telecom and technology companies to deploy turnkey rewards programs with a suite of offerings including cashback coupons and shopping assistants across all mobile and desktop interactions.

For more information on Wildfire Systems' white-label rewards platform and global merchant network please visit https://www.wildfire-corp.com.

About Wildfire Systems Inc.

Wildfire Systems provides an enterprise platform which enables clients to embed social commerce cashback rewards digital coupons and shopping companions within their existing services. Wildfire's patented suite of technologies rewards online shopping and harnesses digital word-of-mouth delivering enhanced user experiences consumer loyalty and new revenue streams for clients. Wildfire drives incremental revenue for over 50000 online merchant programs in over 50 countries. The company is based in San Diego and was founded in 2017. For more information visit www.wildfire-corp.com.

SOURCE Wildfire Systems
Name_3: So You Want to Work Remotely: A Guide (Published 2022)
Text_3:
Months into the pandemic Jess Romano moved from California to Croatia becoming the third person to receive that country’s “digital nomad” visa when it launched in 2021. “When I worked in the office my time off — and more important — the flexibility around where when and how I could work was limited” she said. “Now I can spend months or years at a time living and exploring new places while working full-time.”

Now as coronavirus cases have fallen and working patterns are being reestablished many companies are acknowledging the seismic shifts in the workplace and giving their employees increased flexibility about where they work in both the long and short term.

Kayak the travel search engine embraced remote work early in the pandemic letting its staff set up anywhere the company has a legal entity which includes 25 countries around the world and counting. “If we have a legal entity somewhere we can make payroll pay taxes and offer health care. They would just need the appropriate visa to work there” said Steve Hafner a co-founder and chief executive.

“We used to always compete for talent on the basis of how awesome our offices were to work” he said. “Now we compete on a totally different dimension which is flexibility.”

Name_5: What you need to know about the new credit card surcharge
Text_5:
This story idea came from audience members like you who got in touch with us. Send us all of your questions about the new credit card surcharge. We are listening: ask@cbc.ca.

As of last week you may be paying an additional fee if you choose to pay with your credit card. That's because Canadian retailers can now charge customers using credit cards to pay following a long-standing lawsuit with Visa and MasterCard that was settled earlier this year.

Canadian businesses launched a class-action lawsuit against the two companies in 2011 and the settlement earlier this year refunded them hundreds of millions of dollars worth of fees — known as interchange fees — that they pay any time a customer pays with credit. The settlement also gave them permission to pass those charges on to customers directly which they weren't allowed to do before.

Previously businesses were absorbing the cost of these so-called interchange fees but now many are looking to make up for lost revenue by charging their patrons.

The new rules laid out in the settlement will not apply to Quebec because of the province's Consumer Protection Act which forbids this type of fee.

But what does it all mean for you? We've received a lot of questions from our audience and have answered some of them below.

Why are the credit card fees so high at 2.4 per cent? Couldn't they be capped at 1 per cent?

Actually credit card interchange fees are sometimes higher than 2.4 per cent but the surcharge for customers has been capped at that number due to the settlement.

However the surcharge amount you may be charged when paying depends on which credit card you use.

"The higher the premium of the card the higher the interchange fee" said Luciana Brasil a partner at Vancouver-based law firm Branch MacMaster LLP which worked on the class-action lawsuit that led to the settlement.

That means the more points and rewards you receive from using your credit card the higher you can expect the surcharge to be.

Merchants can also choose to add the surcharge by company brand meaning Visa or MasterCard or they can add it to product types meaning types of Visas or types of MasterCards Brasil added.

The average interchange fee in Canada is 1.4 per cent but depending on the card it could be up to two per cent or more. Regardless of the cap however merchants cannot surcharge more than the actual cost of what is being purchased or paid for.

"It's not a money-making charge. It's a cost recovery charge" said Brasil.

Why are we paying more [interchange fees] than Europeans and others?

In many parts of the world including the European Union Israel the United Kingdom China and Australia interchange fees have been capped at less than one per cent.

On the other hand Canada has some of the highest interchange fees in the world with the average being 1.4 per cent.

Why this is the case is still unclear. However credit card companies determine these rates.

"It's a question for the networks" said Brasil.

Merchants may choose to levy a surcharge on the company brand such as Visa or MasterCard or they can add it to product types meaning specific types of Visas or MasterCards. (Daniel Acker/Bloomberg)

She says her and her team were previously told these fees need to be higher in Canada in order to maintain all the different levels of services that are provided in connection with providing credit to people.

However Australia one of the countries where interchange fees are legally capped is able to provide a comparable level of services for much less.

Understanding why there is such a significant difference is a question they posed in the litigation Brasil says but never received an answer because the case was settled.

There has been talk of introducing legislation to control the fees especially for small- and medium-sized businesses but so far there has not been any news from Ottawa.

Can a surcharge be applied if I use my Visa Debit card?

No a surcharge cannot be applied if you use your Visa Debit card or your Debit MasterCard card. It only applies to credit cards Brasil says.

The debit cards use Interac typically even if labelled as Visa Debit or Debit MasterCard.

This applies to pre-authorized debit transactions such as bill payments as well — they cannot have a surcharge because those bills are using debit. In fact some of your bills can't even be paid with credit cards such as your property tax bill because it's too expensive said Rubina Ahmed-Haq a personal finance expert based in Toronto.

How will added credit card fees affect my buying habits?

Whether it's the increase of self-checkout stations at the grocery store or your local coffee shop that has gone cashless many businesses have recently opted for more frequent use of card transactions — both debit and credit.

With the rise of cashless options and the introduction of credit card surcharges more Canadians will likely be more inclined to pay with Interac via tap options.

"I think the only thing it's going to do is make people more used to using debit but you can use the debit tap thing in all of those cashless environments" said Brasil. "I don't think it's going to affect the ability to pay in a cashless environment."

Debit is also much cheaper for the merchant she added.

However adding a surcharge on the credit card fees may change customer behaviour whether that's changing your buying habits or your mode of payment experts say.

It's also not for certain that all or even many businesses will implement the surcharge.

"My impression is that most businesses are not going to apply this surcharge because they don't want to scare customers away" said Ahmed-Haq.

When it comes to bringing customers into your door and not your competitors choosing not to add the surcharge might be the answer.

"If you have a local coffee shop that you go to or you eat at a restaurant can you imagine if they say we are now adding a surcharge how that would impact people's behaviour" she said. "It's really easy to go next door."

Instead she expects grocery stores to be the first to implement the charge because they are unavoidable for people to feed their families.

Name: Vulcan Materials Company
Name_1: Stellantis announces new deal on raw materials for EV batteries
Text_1:
Jeep maker Stellantis NV on Monday announced it has signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding with a supplier for raw materials needed to build electric-vehicle batteries.

The agreement between Stellantis and GME Resources Limited — which owns a nickel and cobalt project in western Australia — is the latest example of automakers moving to shore up supplies of key raw materials deep into the supply chain to meet the capacity for their EV plans.

The deal with GME is for the "future sale of quantities of battery grade nickel and cobalt sulphate products" from the NiWest Nickel-Cobalt Project according to a news release. That project is expected to produce approximately 90000 tons per year of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate for electric vehicles. A feasibility study for the project is slated to start this month according to Stellantis and GME.

"Every day Stellantis is working to provide our customers clean safe affordable cutting-edge freedom of mobility" Maxime Picat chief purchasing and supply chain officer for the transatlantic automaker said in a statement. "Securing the raw material sources and battery supply will strengthen Stellantis' value chain for electric vehicle battery production and equally important help the company achieve its aggressive decarbonization target."

Stellantis has said it plans to transition 100% of its passenger sales mix in Europe to battery electric vehicles by 2030. And by that time it expects for half of its passenger car and light-duty truck sales mix in the U.S. to be battery electric. It aims to be carbon neutral by 2038.

In a statement Paul Kopejtka managing director of GME said that a definitive agreement with Stellantis "would be a critical step in being able to progress the NiWest Project through to commercial operations" and said that GME hopes the MOU is "the first step in a long-term partnership."

Across the industry automakers have been working to secure raw materials for EV batteries in response to government policies and growing consumer demand for all-electric vehicles.

Earlier this year Stellantis inked deals with Vulcan Energy and Controlled Thermal Resources for supplies of lithium hydroxide for Europe and North America respectively.

General Motors Co. earlier this year announced new supply agreements that it said would help secure all of the raw materials it needs for EV batteries to meet a 2025 goal of having 1 million units of annual EV capacity in North America. And in July Ford Motor Co. executives detailed several deals the company reached to shore up raw materials for battery production as they announced that the automaker had secured 100% of the battery capacity it needs to hit annual EV production capacity of 600000 units by the end of next year.

All three Detroit automakers have announced joint ventures to produce EV batteries in North America.

jgrzelewski@detroitnews.com

Twitter: @JGrzelewski
Name_2: Stellantis GME Resources seal nickel and cobalt deal for battery production
Text_2: Japan's Toyota suffered a seven percent drop in sales in the latest three months to more than 526000 units while FCA part of the Stellantis group which includes the Fiat and Chrysler brands -- saw its sales drop by six percent compared to the same period of 2021.

Name: Berkley
Name_1: OC Restaurant Quest - Republica in Downtown Berkley
Text_1:
OC Restaurant Quest – Republica in Downtown Berkley

Berkley MI- Republica is a Downtown Berkley restaurant with creative food and drink options. It was a great place to visit for The Revolution – a grass-fed beef burger topped with smoke gouda bacon fried egg onion ring arugula tomato and spicy mayo. This amazing burger was topped only by the Smokey Eyes craft cocktail. The best drink I’ve had in my life was made with smokey Mezcal passion fruit liquor cucumber lime and ginger beer. So good. My friend ordered the Flower Roast – a roasted cauliflower served with a tasty walnut garlic pesto sauce. Plus we feasted on Mitch’s Pita Bread and Dip.

Other choices include the tomato fennel soup stuffed eggplant pistachio salmon and spicy goat cheese crustini. The Village Burger is made with lamb topped with feta dill green onion Greek yogurt and yayas beans. There’s also the Buffalo and Blue Chicken featuring organic free range grilled chicken topped with buffalo sauce celery apple and blue cheese slaw.

The beverage menu is exciting as well. The Newest Fashion drink for example includes Traverse City bourbon sweet vermouth luxardo cherries orange and walnut bitters. The Buzzed Bee has Aquavit St. Germain yellow chartreuse and grapefruit. And for something sweet there’s Hard Candy made with vodka sour cherry fresh squeezed lemonade and a sugar rim.

Republica has been serving the Berkley community since 2013. They’re located at 1999 Coolidge Highway. Learn more at www.republicaberkley.com.

Oakland County Times is on a QUEST to enjoy every local restaurant in Oakland County. This long-term project is a labor of love supported by our friends at White Castle. White Castle is a family-owned company that is proud to be one of only 20 large employers to make the Fortune Best Places to work list in 2022. With steam-grilled sliders crispy golden french fries fantastic slides like onion chips or fried clams and the best chocolate shakes White Castle is a by far our top choice for a fast food meal. Check out their website at www.WhiteCastle.com.

Do you have a suggestion for our OAKLAND COUNTY RESTAURANT QUEST? Join in the conversation on Facebook and leave your recommendations.

For all reviews listed by city Click HERE.
Name_2: Royal Oak moves to seek grant make changes along 11 Mile Road
Text_2:
Royal Oak city commissioners unanimously support the city seeking a federal grant in conjunction with three neighboring communities to help fund changes along 11 Mile Road.

City Manager Paul Brake outlined the grant through a federal pilot program under the U.S. Department of Transportation at Monday night’s City Commission meeting.

Elected officials in Royal Oak Berkley Oak Park and Huntington Woods all have to participate to qualify for the grant.

Brake said the grant request will be submitted within a week and cities can get funds within 90 days if it is approved.

“This could bring a transformative change to 11 Mile Road” Brake told commissioners.

Royal Oak is considering road diets streetscape improvements and adding bike lanes to some sections of 11 Mile Road between Stephenson Highway and Woodward Avenue.

Those changes would calm traffic slow motorists’ speed and improve safety for pedestrians and drivers officials said.

The goal among the four participating cities is to improve connectivity between the communities.

“We are reimagining 11 Mile and creating a more pedestrian environment” Brake said.

Besides narrowing the number of lanes along most stretches of the major road the effort would include adding pedestrian islands planting trees and installing some rain gardens.

“Many of these improvements would change the aesthetics and improve the connections to the (four) cities” said City Engineer Holly Donoghue. “I think it is a really great opportunity … where we are connecting across Woodward.”

In Royal Oak the four lanes of 11 Mile Road would likely be reduced to three lanes in many areas and a left-turn lane would be added.

The city already has an 11 Mile Road repaving project set to go in 2025 from Main Street to Campbell Road that work would include traffic lane reductions.

“That’s where we are seeing the accidents now” Donoghue said.

However Royal Oak would have to maintain four full lanes of traffic at the 11 Mile and Woodward intersection she added.

A city traffic study showed that between 2016 to 2020 there were 568 crashes on 11 Mile in Royal Oak with 149 of them resulting in serious injuries.

Royal Oak’s $1.8 million city repaving of 11 Mile is scheduled to take construction through 2028. The work would be done in three segments. From Main to Campbell Woodward to Main and Campbell to Stephenson.

If approved the city would have to put up a $36000 matching grant but would get a total of roughly $186000 to cover some of the costs for streetscape and other related changes.

Even though there would be lane reductions along parts of 11 Mile a traffic study showed that it would increase a motorist’s trip from Woodward to Stephenson by about one minute Donoghue said.

Other cities are also looking at adding pedestrian islands where the roadway runs through their communities Brake said.

Some residents spoke in support of converting 11 Mile Road to a more pedestrian friendly traffic corridor.

Former City Commissioner Jim Rasor an attorney who transformed a former motel into the boutique Hotel Royal Oak at 811 E. 11 Mile Road said he and other business owners in the area favor slowing motor traffic in the area.

“Those cars are going through there at 50 mph” Rasor said. “We urge you to adopt this (lane reduction now).”

Some city commissioners wondered if Royal Oak could start doing some of the road diet now.

But Donoghue citing the multiple moving parts and schedules for the city’s 11 Mile Road resurfacing disagreed.

“I wouldn’t look at doing a rush project” she said.

The schedule is to repave 11 Mile from Main Street to Campbell in 2025; from Campbell to Stephenson in 2027; and from Woodward to Main in 2028.
Name_3: Emily Henry’s ‘People We Meet on Vacation’ Adaptation to Be Directed by Brett Haley
Text_3:
Best-selling author Emily Henry’s book “People We Meet on Vacation” movie adaptation has recruited Brett Haley as its director and Yulin Kuang to adapt the screenplay TheWrap has learned.

Haley was previously best known for writing and directing “Hearts Beat Loud” starring Nick Offerman Kiersey Clemons Ted Danson Sasha Lane Blythe Danner and Toni Collette. His other credits include “The Hero” which premiered at Sundance in competition in 2017 “All The Bright Places” starring Elle Fanning and “All Together Now” which was also recently released on Netflix. Haley has also directed an episode for the Hulu limited series Looking For Alaska based on the award-winning novel of the same name.

Deadline first reported the news.

Published in 2021 by Berkley Books an imprint of Penguin Random House the novel debuted on the New York Times bestseller list spending over a year on the paperback list. The story follows college best friends Alex and Poppy to very different people who vow to take a yearly vacation somewhere every summer.

Henry who most recently published “Book Lovers” and who has a continuing book contract with Berkley Books for at least three more novels after her latest announced “Happy Place” posted Deadline’s piece to her Instagram.

She also later announced the news in her substack newsletter “Emily’s Grocery List” the edition titled “About Time I Told You Some News.”

“People We Meet on Vacation” is (very likely) going to be a movie!” Henry wrote in her newsletter. “I say ‘very likely’ because films are made up of a million moving parts and there’s a saying among authors to not get your hopes up for an adaptation to pan out until you’re actually sitting at the premiere.”

She also announced Haley’s and Kuang’s boarding of the project.

“We have our script” she wrote. “And I love it so much that when I finished reading and set it aside I just started weeping. I felt seen in the exact way that Alex’s story made Poppy feel seen.”

Temple Hill’s Marty Bowen Wyck Godfrey and Isaac Klausner will produce. Laura Quicksilver is overseeing for the company. Erin Siminoff and Sophie Kaplan are overseeing the project for the studio.

Haley is repped by WME manager Jeff Silver at Grandview and attorneys Scott Whitehead and Jeff Frankel. Kuang is represented by UTA Kaplan/Perrone and attorney Phillip Klein. Henry is represented by Taylor Haggerty of Root Literary and UTA.
Name_4: SouthCoast sports roundup for Tuesday Oct. 11
Text_4:
Here's a look at the scores and highlights from Tuesday's high school action on the SouthCoast.

Old Rochester 15 Fairhaven 50

Old Rochester 24 Seekonk 31

Murray Copps ran a first-place time of 16:47 to help clinch the South Coast Conference Championship for ORR. Tyler Young came in second (16:53) while Aidan Silk was sixth (18:46). Torsten Brickley (seventh; 18:55) and Nolan Bushnell (eighth; 19:06) also contributed. Fairhaven’s Nate Branco finished sixth (19:57) against ORR and seventh against Seekonk while Sam Hubert and Scott Joseph also ran well. The Blue Devils (0-5) face Dighton-Rehoboth on Oct. 19.

Somerset Berkley 25 GNB Voc-Tech 33

Daniel Ward (18:12) Owen Vieira (18:14) and Antonio Caneira (20:46) contributed for the Bears (1-5).

COACHING HONOR:'It's unreal'; Old Colony's Brandon Mendez named the Patriots Coach of the Week

GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY

Old Rochester 15 Fairhaven 50

Seekonk 18 Fairhaven 42

Old Rochester’s Hannah Whalley took first in 20:20 to wrap up the South Coast Conference Championship for the Bulldogs. Maddie Conner was third (21:48) and Aubrey Heis came in fourth (21:56) followed by Alexia Gonsalves (fifth; 22:03) and Corinne Robert (sixth; 22:13). Sofia Pereira ran a 25:23 and Gabriela Venturini clocked a 27:40 as the Bears (1-5) captured their first win of the season.

GOLF

Sullivan Memorial Tournament

Bridgewater-Raynham won with 226 points while Dartmouth was third (240) and New Bedford came in seventh (288) at DW Field. For Dartmouth (11-3 5-2 SEC) Chase Guilherme finished third overall with a 75. Will Gangi (sixth; 81) and Ian Emery (tied for eighth; 84) also contributed.

Apponequet 268 Fairhaven 281

Luke Richards Cameron Poirier Pat Stone and Nate Belmore led the way for the Lakers (14-1) at Poquoy Brook Golf Club.

The Cougars finished their season undefeated at 14-0 and won the Mayflower League championship. Luke Butler and Brady Weglowski halved their matches and took the point for best ball. Name_5: Candidate Profile: Steven Elliott U.S. Congress Wayne County
Text_5:
Politics & Government Candidate Profile: Steven Elliott U.S. Congress Wayne County Republican Steven Elliott​ is running for Michigan's newly drawn 12th Congressional District which includes areas of Detroit and Dearborn.

Republican Steven Elliott​ is running for Michigan's newly drawn 12th Congressional District which includes portions of Dearborn Detroit and Southfield. (Steven Elliott)

WAYNE COUNTY MI — Republican Steven Elliott is running for Michigan's newly drawn 12th Congressional District which includes Dearborn and Southfield and portions of Detroit.

Elliott will face Democrat Rashida Tlaib in November's general elections.

Here is how he filled out his candidate profile:

Name Steven Elliott

Campaign website https://www.StevenElliottForCo...

City or town of residence Rochester MI

Office sought U.S. Congress District if applicable 12th Party affiliation

Republican Education High School Business and US Marine trainings/certifications Occupation Business Owner 20+ years

Family Fiance Bora Does anyone in your family work in politics or government? N/A Age

45 Previous public office appointive or elective N/A Why are you seeking this office? To protect the American Dream from radicals like Rashida Tlaib.



What are the major differences between you and the other candidates seeking this post? I will fund our police my opponent wants to defund our police. I support Israel my opponent has been called an antisemite even by Democrat leaders for her remarks regarding Israel. I will secure our Southern border and stop illegal immigration my opponent has advocated for defunding our border patrol. I believe in America and capitalism my opponent is a radical Socialist who degrades America and is a cheerleader for Marxists policies.



If you are challenging an incumbent in what way has the current officeholder failed the community?

Rashida Tlaib has focused on radical Socialist policies which have made our community less safe created a crisis on our Southern border caused high inflation increased gas prices and harmed small businesses. Do you think the federal government can or should do more to curb inflation which has led to an increase in prices for food gas and other goods? Yes the federal government needs to slow down spending and decrease our debt. We also need to invest in American oil and gas to lower fuel prices. Do you support changing the state’s constitution to ensure that women have to right to get an abortion? I do not think Abortion is an issue for the Constitution. It is an issue for the legislature and Governor to handle.

Do you support the Raise the Wage ballot initiative which would increase the minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2027 and provide cost-of-living increases in later years? I think minimum wage increases create more inflation harming the very people it is intended to help. It also encourages businesses to hire fewer people again harming the very people it is intended to help. Sounds nice but fails to achieve the goals implied. Would you support an election initiative to require another audit of the 2020 presidential election to transfer authority over the audit from the Secretary of State to a newly created auditing panel and to change how elections are reviewed in the future? I think all elections should be thoroughly reviewed by an independent body to eliminate fraud and improve voter confidence.



What other issues do you intend to address during your campaign? Safer Streets.

Better Schools.

Lower Taxes.

More Freedom.

What accomplishments in your past would you cite as evidence you can handle this job? I am a Veteran of the United States Marine Corps and small business owner What is the best advice anyone ever gave you? Lead with a servants heart Is there anything else you would like voters to know about yourself and your positions?

I love this great nation and our state.

Name: Wabtec
Name_1: Rail Insider-Product update: Tank cars 2022. Information For Rail Career Professionals From Progressive Railroading ...
Text_1:
October 2022

Rail News: Mechanical

Photo – Trinity Rail Group

Compiled by Grace Renderman Associate Editor

Trinity Rail Group

Trinity Rail Group offers a full line of tank cars as well as engineering and manufacturing resources. The company has delivered 150000 tank cars to its North American and international customers in the past 20 years Trinity officials said in an email.

The company also offers on-site field support for training and technical assistance and mobile and on-site repair services. Parts and essential maintenance services for operational performance and regulatory compliance are available as well including rail-car retrofits and other modifications and periodic certification inspections.

The company’s Trinsight® an end-to-end supply chain platform combines real-time tracking with data analysis to optimize supply-chain performance. Cloud-enabled data insights and analytics help rail shippers to make more informed decisions to improve operations and reduce costs.

Meanwhile Trinity’s shipment management application enables real-time tracking of rail cars so users can view location and status. Trinsight offers numerous sensor options and unique configurations to create tailored reports and real-time critical alerts Trinity officials said.

The customer profile application captures yard fleet geofence commodity cost and status information. The data helps build detailed profiles unique to a customer’s operation using internal fleet designations and user-defined commodity types.

An additional service from Trinity is a yard management system to monitor rail cars from entry to exit of a rail yard.

Wabtec Corp.

Wabtec Corp.

Wabtec Corp. provides components that secure and protect cargo and help optimize loading and unloading processes. The company’s components are designed to improve safety reliability and productivity.

For tank cars Wabtec offers manway covers and bottom outlet components. Wabtec manway covers are cast-steel AAR M201 Grade B covers. The bottom outlet cap and plug features a quick disconnect adapter nozzle and is available in carbon steel stainless steel or aluminum. Wabtec also offers a number of accessories including outlet saddles seal pins lock caps and skid plates.

Amsted Digital Solutions Inc.

Amsted Digital Solutions Inc.

The Bogie IQ™ gateway part of the Amsted Digital Solutions Inc. IQ Series of devices is an onboard telematics device that monitors the changing conditions of a tank car’s wheelset and brake system performance without using wireless sensors Amsted officials said.

Through the company’s Supply Chain Visibility™ software platform users gain real-time access to data including onboard component health monitoring and location data to manage inbound empties outbound high-priority loaded cars and first-mile/last-mile verification.

Key features and benefits include automated reporting up to every 15 minutes; more than seven years of device life; forward compatibility with 5G technology; BLE standard communication protocols that support wireless sensors; built-in object character recognition and barcode scanning; and ruggedized low-profile devices certified to ATEX Zone 1 and Class I Division 2.

Amsted also offers an array of professional services related to fleet management as well as tank-car engineering and regulatory compliance to help shippers to shift their focus to other priorities company officials said.

The Greenbrier Cos. Inc.

The Greenbrier Cos. Inc. offers more than 40 tank-car designs. In North America the company operates three certified tank-car manufacturing locations and three certified repair shops and manages more than 36000 tank cars.

The global rail transportation equipment supplier pairs innovation and expertise with a capacity to build and repair transportation equipment Greenbrier officials said.

The company’s online tank-car resource — which can be accessed at go.gbrx.com/tankcars — helps shippers learn more about tank cars including upcoming regulation deadlines.

Email comments or questions to grace.renderman@tradepress.com.

Name: Walgreens Boots Alliance
Name_1: Walgreens Boots Alliance Accelerates Full Acquisition of CareCentrix
Text_1:
DEERFIELD Ill. October 11 2022 - Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA) today announced the acceleration of its plans to acquire full ownership of CareCentrix (CCX Next LLC) expanding its reach into the growing homecare sector and advancing its healthcare long-term growth strategy.

This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20221011005386/en/

WBA has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the remaining 45% stake for approximately $392 million which is based on the exit multiple agreed to at the time of WBA's initial majority investment announcement in CareCentrix.

CareCentrix is an industry leader in the $75 billion post-acute and home care industry providing care coordination and outsourced benefit management services. WBA’s full acquisition of CareCentrix follows WBA’s 55% majority investment in the company which closed on August 31 2022. The full acquisition is subject to limited customary closing conditions and is expected to close by March 2023.

“We continue to see strong results and potential for growth from our partnership with CareCentrix. Our full acquisition further accelerates our transformation to become a consumer-centric healthcare company leveraging innovative platforms that extend our capabilities into fast-growing segments of healthcare” said Roz Brewer CEO WBA. “CareCentrix is key to offering services to our patients at every stage of the care continuum and to driving long-term sustainable growth as part of our U.S. Healthcare strategy.”

CareCentrix currently manages care for more than 19 million members through over 7400 provider locations offering a suite of services on an integrated basis to support home care models – including home nursing durable medical equipment home infusion and in-home palliative care. By helping to accelerate the transition of care to patients’ homes CareCentrix provides one of the core elements to support value-based care on behalf of health plans and providers.

In WBA’s fiscal year 2021 CareCentrix delivered pro forma sales of $1.5 billion. The company will continue as a distinct business and brand within Walgreens following the full acquisition.

“We are thrilled to be part of WBA’s vision to transform local healthcare and develop new valued-based models” said John Driscoll CEO CareCentrix. “A major component of the future of healthcare is in the home and CareCentrix is critical to enabling WBA to serve patients wherever and however works best for them.”

New Leader of WBA’s U.S. Healthcare

Additionally Driscoll will assume a new role as executive vice president and president U.S. Healthcare at WBA including Walgreens Health later this month. He will report directly to Brewer and serve on WBA’s executive committee. CareCentrix Chief Financial Officer Steve Horowitz will assume the role of CareCentrix CEO.

“John brings a wealth of experience and leadership across many different aspects of healthcare all of which will play an important role in delivering on our vision to reimagine local healthcare for all” Brewer said. “He has demonstrated high levels of success by building winning teams and rapidly scaling technology-enabled solutions and analytics that make healthcare more personal and effective.”

Driscoll will oversee U.S. Healthcare for WBA as the company expands into larger faster-growing profit pools that drive synergies across the care continuum including provider enablement and managed service organizations primary care population health home health post-acute care specialty pharmacy and retail pharmacy. U.S. Healthcare encompasses integrations with WBA’s market-leading healthcare partners including VillageMD Shields Health Solutions and CareCentrix as well as the organic Walgreens Health business which focuses on population health through initiatives such as Walgreens Health Corners.

“It is an honor to take this leadership position with a company committed to integrating the key pieces to deliver better healthcare at lower costs to so many” Driscoll said. “I look forward to working closely with Roz and WBA’s U.S. Healthcare leadership team to create a truly differentiated experience for consumers across their healthcare journey while bringing greater value to payors providers and other partners.”

Driscoll is a proven and trusted leader with more than 25 years of deep healthcare expertise. Prior to CareCentrix he served as president at Castlight Health a digital healthcare company and before that as group president for new markets at Medco (a $70 billion PBM or pharmacy benefit manager). He led product development and was part of the executive team that spun Medco out of Merck building an enterprise that was named the most admired company in healthcare services by Fortune for several consecutive years.

Driscoll was also responsible for Medco’s entry into Medicare growing the business from start-up to $20 billion in annual revenue. He led Medco’s acquisitions and investments investing over $10 billion in capital in high-growth companies including specialty pharmacy Accredo Health. During Driscoll’s tenure he led retail network contracting Medco’s data products Medco International and Medco’s specialty pharmacy business.

Driscoll founded and chaired the Surescripts ePrescribing Network building the first cross-industry collaborative with competing retail PBM and health plans cooperating to revolutionize e-prescribing. Surescripts has grown from servicing under 50 million prescriptions in 2005 to more than 1 billion prescriptions today.

Driscoll was selected by the White House for its Entrepreneurs in Residence program in 2011 to advise the FDA on new paths for innovation. He holds a B.A. and M.B.A. from Harvard University and an MPhil from Cambridge University in England.

About Walgreens Boots Alliance

Walgreens Boots Alliance (Nasdaq: WBA) is an integrated healthcare pharmacy and retail leader serving millions of customers and patients every day with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities.

A trusted global innovator in retail pharmacy with approximately 13000 locations across the U.S. Europe and Latin America WBA plays a critical role in the healthcare ecosystem. The company is reimagining local healthcare and well-being for all as part of its purpose – to create more joyful lives through better health. Through dispensing medicines improving access to a wide range of health services providing high quality health and beauty products and offering anytime anywhere convenience across its digital platforms WBA is shaping the future of healthcare.

WBA has more than 315000 team members and a presence in nine countries through its portfolio of consumer brands: Walgreens Boots Duane Reade the No7 Beauty Company Benavides in Mexico and Ahumada in Chile. Additionally WBA has a portfolio of healthcare-focused investments located in several countries including China and the U.S.

The company is proud of its contributions to healthy communities a healthy planet an inclusive workplace and a sustainable marketplace. WBA has been recognized for its commitment to operating sustainably: it is an index component of the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices (DJSI) and was named to the 100 Best Corporate Citizens 2021.

More company information is available at www.walgreensbootsalliance.com.

(WBA-GEN)

Cautionary note regarding forward-looking statements

All statements in this release that are not historical including without limitation those regarding the closing and anticipated effects of the CareCentrix transaction are forward-looking statements made pursuant to the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Words such as “expect” “likely” “outlook” “forecast” “preliminary” “pilot” “project” “intend” “plan” “goal” “target” “aim” “continue” “believe” “seek” “anticipate” “upcoming” “may” “possible” and variations of such words and similar expressions are intended to identify such forward-looking statements.

These forward-looking statements are not guarantees of future performance and are subject to risks uncertainties and assumptions known or unknown that could cause actual results to vary materially from those indicated or anticipated. These risks assumptions and uncertainties include those described in Item 1A (Risk Factors) of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended Aug. 31 2021 and in other documents that we file or furnish with the Securities and Exchange Commission. If one or more of these risks or uncertainties materializes or if underlying assumptions prove incorrect actual results may vary materially from those indicated or anticipated by such forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements we make or that are made on our behalf are qualified by these cautionary statements. Accordingly you should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements which speak only as of the date they are made.

We do not undertake and expressly disclaim any duty or obligation to update publicly any forward-looking statement after the date of this release whether as a result of new information future events changes in assumptions or otherwise.
